newsitem.title: ITALY: Marzotto sees 1997 turnover up 4-5 pct.
newsitem.headline: Marzotto sees 1997 turnover up 4-5 pct.

text.p: Italian clothing and textiles group Marzotto said it expected turnover in 1997 to increase four to five percent and for net profits to improve, although not necessarily by the same rate as in the first quarter of 1997.

Marzotto's managing director Jean De Jaegher said at a shareholders meeting to approve the group's 1996 accounts that profits in the first quarter of 1997 rose 24 percent to 29.4 billion lire while operating profits were 112.4 billion lire.
For the whole of 1997, the group said it had an objective for operating profits of 230 billion lire after 200 billion lire in 1996.

In the first four months of 1997, sales rose 4.6 percent to 868 billion lire with 28 percent of sales in Italy (30.9 percent in the first four months of 1996) and 72 percent on markets outside Italy (from 69.1 percent in the same period of 1996).
